result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharon M Enz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Agent to approve of anyone staying with or using the defendant's residence.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Plea/sentencing Hearing.
In person/zoom appearances.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the Amended Charge of PTC of 
Misdemeanor Bail Jumping. Convicted.

Sentence Withheld. Defendant is placed on probation to DOC for twelve (12) months,
Conditions of probation are:
1) Pay supervision fees in the amount to be determined by DOC;
2) Pay costs of action;
3) Submit DNA sample;
4) Agent to approve of anyone staying with or using the defendant's residence. 
Minutes.
Order Granting Request to Appear Remotely.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling conference on August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Further proceedings on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:42 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sharon M Enz in court.  Attorney Lonnie D Story appeared by video for Sharon M Enz. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing. Email inducement dated 06-08-22. Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:32 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sharon Enz appeared by video.  Attorney Lonnie Story appearing by video for defendant. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 06-17-22 at 3:00 p.m.
